Reviews.Title: Great for what it is!
Reviews.Author: Rookiecookie
Reviews.Content: Purchased this phone to bridge over the time between receiving a replacement Samsung for my totally broken Cr*pberry Torch (a whole separate story). For a $20 phone, this little phone is amazing versatile! Sound quality is excellent, no trouble with texting, voice mail is fine, speaker phone quality good, etc. If you use a phone as a computer, this isn't for you, but if you actually use a phone as a phone, this is a great little device.

Reviews.Title: Practical and Well Priced
Reviews.Author: Nerd Alert
Reviews.Content: My old phone broke and I am waiting to decide on a smartphone, trying to get the cheapest data plan.  In the meantime, I needed something for talk and text.  There are a couple flip phones in the $20 price range, as well as this Alcatel 510A bar-type.  Can a $20 phone really work?BUILDThe plastic case and screen feel sturdy.  Ironically, plastic phones tend to be much more durable than the more expensive phones with Gorilla Glass.  The back has a surprisingly thoughtful touch: a soft rubberized grip.  While the phone looks cheap, the design is not bad and it fits well in the hand.CALL QUALITYThe phone sounds surprisingly good, and that includes the speakerphone.  The reception is a bit less than my old phone, but not terrible.SOFTWAREWhile not very intuitive, the 510A can be figured out without too many headaches.  I have texted, set an alarm to wake me up (practically worth the price alone since it has a battery backup), and inserted contacts.  The alarm and ring tones are pretty bad, and there is no SD card slot to add any.  The phone has no lock, though I have yet to butt dial.The web browser is essentially useless, but the screen would have assured that regardless...SCREENThe phone exceeded my small expectations in other areas, but the screen is like something out of the past.  It has a narrow viewing angle, is tiny (there is plenty of unused space around it), and the image looks fuzzy/garbled.  It works for the basic uses of the phone, but even for texting, something a bit less dated would be nice.  As with most cell phone screens, it is hard to see in sunlight.CAMERANope.SETUPI already have an AT&T; phone on a family plan, so I just put in my card and was ready to go.  Unlike Android, there is no way to automatically sync contacts, so they all have to be put in manually.  A SIM card is included for those who want to start a new plan.OVERALLFor $20, this phone is great as a backup, or if you need a phone without a camera temporarily (jury duty, business, etc.).  If you only use a phone for periodic texting, phone calls, and as an alarm, this may even be a good permanent phone.  However, if you text a lot, you may want to invest a little more in one with a keyboard or decent touchscreen.EDIT:  I found that there is a function to lock the keypad, which is great.  It is just a little unintuitive to find.

Reviews.Title: All in the Details
Reviews.Author: Zavi
Reviews.Content: I got this for a "drop phone" meaning emergency use only.  Any phone with a charge, sim card and battery can be used to dial 911 for an emergency even without a pay plan per law.  So, this is going in the emergency car kit in the trunk along with a cell phone charger.  If I need another phone, I can also active this through AT&T; for a small fee of $2.00 per day and get:A. Unlimited Nationwide CallingB. Unlimited MessagingC. Unlimited TextingD. Pay per use: 1 cent for 5/kb dataNot bad for a back up phone either.I recommend this for emergency and backup phone use.Vidimo Se!

Reviews.Title: Good phone for the price
Reviews.Author: Brendan Long
Reviews.Content: I got this as a backup for my smart phone, and it's actually better than I expected in some ways. Most of the cons are pretty obvious, given the size and price. The only one that really bothers me is how bad the predictive texting is.Pros:  * Cheap  * Small  * Light  * The whole case is made of plastic, but it feels very solid since everything fits together tightly.  * It has a removable battery.  * It charges via Micro-USB.  * The battery lasts forever.Cons:  * No camera or bluetooth.  * Predictive texting engine doesn't learn words. It also doesn't come with common words like "sushi". This would be extremely annoying if this was my primary phone.  * The small size means the keyboard takes some getting used to and the screen isn't large enough to use the included browser.  * It was relatively difficult to set up MMS settings for my carrier (not AT&T;). Voice and normal texting worked fine with no special settings though.  * It has one of those annoying Micro-USB slot covers. I immediately ripped it off.Conclusion: If you don't care about texting, cameras or bluetooth, this would be a great phone. If you do care about those things, it's still a good backup phone.

Reviews.Title: Quite possibly the worst telephone ever designed by mankind
Reviews.Author: Juvenal
Reviews.Content: The Alcatel 510a is a marvel of East German engineering. Nothing on it works well or correctly or consistently except the one feature that will allow the police to develop an extremely close relationship with you.The ringtone cannot  be heard under normal conditions. Even very mild background noise drowns out the insipid sound of this phone failing in the most basic function of all telecommunications equipment: Alerting you that you have a call.The battery drains astonishingly quickly. Most of you out there probably don't dabble in philosophy at all, but this phone will have you pondering the utter futility of recharging your 510a an average of once per day when it doesn't function even with the battery fully charged.But by golly, that feature that no one uses and which shouldn't exist--and which neither the owner's manual nor the AT&T; salesmen will tell you about--the one that allows you to call 911 by holding down the send or 9 key for a full second? Works every time. And I do mean EVERY time you take a step with this piece of junk in your pants pocket.I tried going to the AT&T; store and asking for a different cheap phone, but all they do is say "No" without saying "No," which is apparently some sort of postmodern doctrine of customer service: Their salesdrones aren't allowed to say no. They have to say "No" by insulting the customer's intelligence with double talk and meaningless gibberish.I am fed up with AT&T; and with this product, and with this dangerous, useless, stupid feature that they are apparently compelled to include (but must never mention) in all their devices as a provision of Obamacare. Don't try to save money by buying it. It will cost you your dignity and, depending on how fed up your local police get with your constant emergency calls, maybe your freedom.

Reviews.Title: Good one
Reviews.Author: A R
Reviews.Content: Nice phone , good price , good visuals. I would highly recommend especially for the kids. Quick delivery. Very good decision to buy this.

Reviews.Title: Great for porting!
Reviews.Author: Trust Me
Reviews.Content: I got this phone for one reason only -- I was porting a land line to Google Voice.After confirming that my land number was eligible to be ported to an AT&T; Gophone, I order the phone and the cheapest prepaid plan I could.  During the activation process I ported my land line number.  Once that worked I called AT&T; to get my actual account number (they don't tell you unless you ask, you usually use the phone number to access your account.)  With that in hand it was simple to port the number to my Google Voice account.  While I was waiting for the porting to be completed from AT&T; to Google Voice, I simply set the phone to forward calls to my Google Voice number, which rings on my real cell phone.This phone is cheap cheap cheap, but for what I used it for it was perfect.

Reviews.Title: Easy to erroneously dial 911 even when phone is locked
Reviews.Author: D. Thompson
Reviews.Content: Phone dialed 911 on its own in my pocket, with the keys locked, twice, so I returned it.  This sometimes appears to happen on other Alcatel flat phones: see reviews of Alcatel 871A: http://www.amazon.com/Alcatel-871A-Prepaid-GoPhone-AT/product-reviews/B00ACPF9IQ/ref=dp_top_cm_cr_acr_txt?ie=UTF8&showViewpoints;=1.  One of those reviews notes that a software fix may be coming from AT&T.;

Reviews.Title: Good for the Price
Reviews.Author: C. Williams
Reviews.Content: Great little phone for the price. Does everything is says. We have had it for about a month now with no problems. The key lock was a little tricky to figure out, but we just did a quick Google search and found the answer. It has survived several drops from several feet in the air with no damage, so that is a major plus! I knew the phone did not have a camera, but I was pleasantly surprised to find out it could receive pics. The only things that prevented 5 stars would be the loudness of the ringtones, but they aren't extremely low, so it will do.

Reviews.Title: Very nice and easy to use phone. My old LG was a total pain
Reviews.Author: Edward C. McClelland
Reviews.Content: It is a very nice and easy to use phone. My old LG was a total pain having to press button several times for listen to voice mail etc. I am so far very happy with this little phone.

Reviews.Title: good basic phone
Reviews.Author: M. Turk
Reviews.Content: my daughter uses it.  she hates it for texting but says the battery lasts a pretty long time. reception is good

Reviews.Title: Great Little Device
Reviews.Author: Lindalealphamale
Reviews.Content: A great, dependable basic feature phone. I was on scaffolding at a construction site and dropped it from 20 feet onto concrete. It scratched the side a bit but the phone still works great. Bought a batch for my crew and they all love it.

Reviews.Title: affordable phone
Reviews.Author: Helpful comment person
Reviews.Content: We needed a low cost phone, we got one.The biggest issue has been ring tone. The default setting for ring tone appears to be "library hush mode". Very frustrating compared to easy smartphone interfaces. I think we have fixed this finally, today. I got this from the Radio Shack web site:"Alcatel OT-510AIssue: Call volume is too low, trouble hearing caller.Assuming all normal volume adjustments have been checked, this phone has additional adjustments that may fix the issue.Settings > Profile > Options > Customize > choose "RING TYPE"Of the 3 choices under Ring Type >> CHOOSE "Repeat"This will correct the call volume to normal."Do this, then use the option button to save. Bingo! ring tone is louder, finally. We chose Cricket for its obnoxious loudness.

Reviews.Title: Good phone for price
Reviews.Author: R. Maddi
Reviews.Content: We bought this for our 14 year old to have a phone and be able to call and text us without paying a data charge.  Works perfectly for that, just a basic phone.

Reviews.Title: good burner
Reviews.Author: Jonathan Drechsler
Reviews.Content: I got this as a sporting phone, due to the cost it is essentially disposable if something happens to it, the transflexive display is nice in adverse lighting conditions like direct sun, the rubberized back makes it easier to hold when your hands are sweaty/cold/ etc.A few things to note, the at&t; app center store is no longer in service so you cannot buy additional apps for this phone if you are on at&t.;  also the screen resolution is low so reading text messages requires a lot of scrolling down

Reviews.Title: OK cheap phone but watch out
Reviews.Author: B. Smith "thefettler"
Reviews.Content: The third day I had this phone it pocket dialed 911. If you hold down send for 2 seconds it calls 911. Even when keys are locked. No way to disable it. This "feature" almost made me get a new phone. Since it was a $20 phone I thought I would rip out the send button and see what happens. Turns out I rarely need the send button and can reach inside the new hole I created to press send. I will keep it for now and see if I can adapt. If I could do it over for free I would not have bought this phone. Miss my Nokia.

Reviews.Title: worth for money
Reviews.Author: srinath
Reviews.Content: This is a basic phone ..worked well...anybody can operate. nice battery life. got on deal from amazon... best in this range phones

Reviews.Title: Love the phone
Reviews.Author: Martha A. Sheffield
Reviews.Content: I really like the  phone, but only used it until I got another one, now I can have it for a spare.

Reviews.Title: 510a
Reviews.Author: buck
Reviews.Content: Is there any way i can set the phone to answer on any key, the phone number in the book is not a working nunber. went back to store with 2 questions and they could not help.

Reviews.Title: light, durable, awkward text program
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Well, that about sums it up.  I like the size and it works well, but texting is a pain. After a couple of months I am getting used to its quirks. Otherwise handy and reliable, especially for the price.  I wonder whether it is possible to change the texting software?

Reviews.Title: rugged, LOOONG batter life
Reviews.Author: rpv
Reviews.Content: I got this phone for a 1000+ mile trip. The battery lasts over 5 days on just talk. I did not want to rely on a smartphone looking over battery..  Very rugged, unfortunately locked to ATT. Contacting ATT to unlock it was denied as it is prepaid, otherwise would have been super awesome.  I put a microsim into a adapter (home made) and use in this. Has speakerphone. Music only accepts MIDI and WAV, no mp3 support which is a small negative. It has 48 MB free space. out of the box. Has Image Viewer also.

Reviews.Title: This is really good.
Reviews.Author: Hyunsung Choi
Reviews.Content: It's very simple to use. I just want to use it for 4 months.However there is a little bit inconvenience to send a text.Just use it as a phone, not a text usage.

Reviews.Title: Don't buy
Reviews.Author: Asa R Walker
Reviews.Content: The Battery will not last the whole day. Just made a few short calls and by evening, all the power is gone.

Reviews.Title: JUST WHAT WE NEEDED
Reviews.Author: Edward P. Staley
Reviews.Content: HATE THE NEW PHONES WITH TOO MUCH STUFF ON THEM AND SMALL BUTTONS.  THIS IS A PAY AS YOU GO PHONE, BUT WE THREW OUT THE "PAY AS YOU GO CARD' AND INSTALLED OUR ATT CARD.  MY WIFE LOVES IT AND I DO ALSO.  A GREAT BUY IF YOU HAVE LARGE FINGERS AND WANT A SIMPLE PHONE.  CHEAP ALSO.  WILL BUY A SECOND ONE SOON.  SEEMS TO BE VERY STURDY.

Reviews.Title: Needs louder ringtone
Reviews.Author: Shirley A. Pheasant
Reviews.Content: I wanted a basic easy to use phone; this is easy to use.  The only thing that I really don't like is the ringtone.  Even with the volume turned the whole way up, I don't always hear it.  No other complaints.

Reviews.Title: Works great!
Reviews.Author: SimsGal "denise"
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a basic phone that has decent battery life and great sound quality, this is the phone for you. It's a great product.

Reviews.Title: Good phone for calls only
Reviews.Author: Shelly
Reviews.Content: This is a great backup phone if you've lost your own. Or also great phone for those who only use their phone for simple phone calls

Reviews.Title: Great value
Reviews.Author: heidi glass
Reviews.Content: I bought two of these phones to replace old broken phones for my kids. They are in middle school and do not always take the best care of their phones. It was a great product for them and did everything they needed. The phones are durable and have lasted fine since Christmas. A few days ago my son washed his. We laid the phone out and allowed it to dry with the battery out. Then plugged it in. After getting a new sim card for the phone it works great. I was amazed the phone worked perfectly after going through the washing machine.

Reviews.Title: not bad
Reviews.Author: LUNGX
Reviews.Content: Every thing about this cell phone is okay. But the screen is not very good. Besides, the actual standby time is about 3 days.

Reviews.Title: Great little phone
Reviews.Author: Mary A "Good Neighbor"
Reviews.Content: Got this as a backup for traveling outside my home area.  Works very well, sound quality excellent.  Does what you need to text or make call.  Love its small compact size and weight is minimal.

Reviews.Title: Great Phone For The Price
Reviews.Author: John Thomas
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a good reliable mobile device to provide for my two kids.  Something that had a perfect balance of ease of usability, basic data access, and robustness.This fit the bill.  Nice job Alcatel.  Looking forward to many more products.

Reviews.Title: Dials 911 far too easily
Reviews.Author: J. McPhee
Reviews.Content: This is a nice inexpensive phone with basic features. Works well (at least for the couple of months my husband has owned it). Unfortunately, it allows the butt dialing of 911 far too easily. All you have to do is inadvertently press and briefly hold the send key and it will ask you if you want to call emergency services...and other wiggle in your pocket and the "yes" is pressed. After it called 911 accidentally, my husband refuses to carry it around. I wish we has read reviews before picking it up at our local AT&T; store.UPDATE Aug/2013: My husband decided to give the phone another try but after just a few months he butt-dialed the state troopers while the phone was locked. The troopers were not amused. Neither was my husband. We are getting a new phone asap.

Reviews.Title: Defective Phone
Reviews.Author: unhappy
Reviews.Content: I bought this phone at local AT&T; store. In a few weeks, it dialed 911 automatically when I put it in my pocket. 911 called me back and it was very embarrassing. The phone locked most buttons after the preset time, but 9 and 1 were never locked. So there is a good chance it dials 911.I tried to return the phone to store, they would charge $35 restocking fee, ridiculous. After talking to a store manager at another visit, the restocking fee was waived and I returned the phone. Worst phone and experience ever. The AT&T; store is in Woburn Mall MA

Reviews.Title: Phone that works well as a phone
Reviews.Author: Julie R.
Reviews.Content: The Best:  sound quality - I can hear my callers and they can hear me. If all you use your phone for is to makes phone calls, this is a good choice. I have no complaints at all about call sound quality.______________________________The Good:5 alarm settings. Can customize to repeat once, everyday, or selectable days. Can also customize snooze time from one to five minutes. Can customize alarm tone. It's plenty loud and has never failed to awaken or alert me.Voice recorder - not the greatest recorder, but better than nothing.Calendar - I can set appointments & reminders through the calendarIt has a length and weight unit converter.It has a speakerphone.Compatible with TTY devices. Don't use, so don't know how well this works.Supposedly has MMS and internet capability.  Don't use, so don't know how well this works.______________________________The Not So Good:Texting is frustrating. I dislike predictive texting, but you can't definitively turn it off on this phone. I changed the phone settings to "Abc", but the stupid thing doesn't recognize that a period signals a need for a capital letter. Must hit the star key six times to get a non-predictive capital letter. Also often doesn't put a space when I use the space bar.Battery life is less than optimal. I make about three hours of phone calls and maybe five texts per day. Have four daily alarms. No internet, no apps, no games, no wallpaper, screen set to turn off after 30 seconds. I usually have one bar at the end of the day.No notes or task organizer. Must set reminders through the calendar. I now use the draft section of messages to keep notes to myselfCalculator is clunky and has no percentage key. Or decimal point.Some of the ringtones are softer than others. Unfortunately, the two classic ringers are two of the softer tones. "Cricket," however, will jar your teeth.It seems that if you turn down the volume for a call (to lower a caller's voice), it affects the ringtone volume also.  Not completely sure about this, as the volume rocker switch is also easily hit when retrieving the phone from a pocket._________________________________I use my regular sim (not go-phone sim) and the phone works fine. I have had it about 3 months and it has never accidentally dialed 911.( I carry my phone in a shirt pocket, not pants pocket.) It has never randomly shut down and it doesn't drop any more calls than more expensive phones do.I bought this as an emergency phone from BB big box store for nine ninety nine, brand new. All in all, I would buy again, as, despite its faults, it does the one thing a phone absolutely MUST do: it makes a clear phone call!

Reviews.Title: 3 Months service before it goes haywire
Reviews.Author: rocks911
Reviews.Content: I purchased this phone 3 months ago and it has started to act erratically. It is not usable. I liked it but 3 months use is ridiculous. I am not hard on phones, I make a couple of calls a day, thats it. I have to completely dismantle the phone to get it to work once, then do it all over again to dial out. I cannot receive calls. I have not damaged the phone in any way.It seems like designed obsolescence to me. I wont buy Alcatel again.

Reviews.Title: Sounds Unsound!
Reviews.Author: Paul "wds"
Reviews.Content: Will not ring when it is supposed to (but this might save you from troublesome callers sometimes).  The party on the other end cannot hear, even if you shout at the top of your voice. This little phone consumes the power like a monster. It even creates doubt if I forgot to charge.You keep talking on this phone, and after sometime you don't hear anything from the other side, increase your voice thinking that you are talking too soft. When you look at the phone, it decided on its own you had enough, disconnected the call and back to the main screen.It has some very unique features like shutting down when it feels like it is working very hard for you. Will show the battery is full even though it is not.The last but not the least, it does everything except connecting the call. However,  this phone will be the best life safer because it connects to  911 emergency services on its own (it does not matter whether you are in trouble or not, the phone will decide). If your first dialing number happens to be 9 and you paused for a couple seconds to dial the next digit, you are sure to be connected to the emergency services. ( The most caring phone for the owner. ) I suggest that Alcatel should consider bringing out some emergency kits, and I am sure they will be hot-sell in the market than their phones.Please purchase this phone and use it at least a month for the first hand experience of all other features.  (Caution: You are doing so at your own risk!). It will be an unforgettable experience of all of your life!

Reviews.Title: Not worth it . There are better ones for same price
Reviews.Author: ProductExpert "science2000"
Reviews.Content: The battery lasted 4 days on standby.The battery died after 40 days.The phone was nearly impossible to see clearly sincethe screen is small.The buttons were responsive but so close togetherand tiny they were meant for fingers made like pencils.Quality of sound was 'good enough'.Quality of my voice to recipient was 'good enough'.Overall a 1 out of 5 stars.. barely worth buyingThe z221 is larger and may be more useful to you.It's found online for $27 and less

Reviews.Title: The worse cell phone (battery) ever.
Reviews.Author: frontier
Reviews.Content: The battery with fully charged went completely empty after 2 days without using it.The worse phone ever.Do not recommend to buy this phone.

Reviews.Title: dont buy it!
Reviews.Author: amy ehrlich
Reviews.Content: the phone randomly turns onrandomly calls 911phone randomly goes on silent so calls are not heardits not like the phone was all that inexpensive.what a waste of money and timehave same phone for each of my kids and this happened on both phones so this was not just a one time thing.

Reviews.Title: easily one of the worst purchases I ever made
Reviews.Author: victoire805
Reviews.Content: Have put up with this phone 3 months being too busy to get to store to return.  There are so many problems with this phone I won't even attempt to list them all.  Here are some:  horrible battery life; warning before battery dies is about 3 seconds; the alarm goes off minutes after I set it (time set for next morning) for no reason; icons that are unexplained in the manual; obnoxious ring and alert options; complicated to navigate menus and change settings; phone makes loud elongated ATT jingle when turning off, thereby disturbing those I'm trying not to disturb by receiving an untimely call or message; features that were on phone first few days have disappeared, such as voice recorder, timer, and speakerphone.  The list actually goes on.  Don't buy this phone, despite its affordability.  You get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: not what i thought it would be
Reviews.Author: carol howard
Reviews.Content: just dont like it i read the description wrong and if iknew id woud never gotten it in the first place

Reviews.Title: Terrible - Dials 911 by itself all the time
Reviews.Author: bman
Reviews.Content: If you have any desire to keep this phone in your pocket, purse or bag do not buy it.  It will dial 911 automatically if the number 9 is pressed for longer than a couple seconds, EVEN IF YOU LOCK YOUR KEYPAD!!!!  Yikes!!!  I called ATT  technical support and they said there is no way to change it.

Reviews.Title: yeah
Reviews.Author: Blige
Reviews.Content: It's a good dope boy flop . But don't buy this jive . But if you have to . Get a tmoblie prepaid . Best s*** ever

ProductInfo.Features: What's in the Box: handset, rechargeable battery, charger, quick start guide.
ProductInfo.Name: Alcatel 510A Prepaid GoPhone (AT&T)
